Sentencas: Direct electrochemical oxidation (DECO) solid-oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) offer the potential to generate electrical power from hydrocarbon fuels without the need for upstream fuel processing, such as reforming.
Titulo: Homogeneous kinetics and equilibrium predictions of coking propensity in the anode channels of direct oxidation solid-oxide fuel cells using dry natural gas

Sentencas: However, with pure hydrocarbon fuel entering the flow channels at temperatures typically above 700degreesC, fuel pyrolysis can cause molecular-weight growth and the formation of deleterious carbonaceous deposits.
Titulo: Homogeneous kinetics and equilibrium predictions of coking propensity in the anode channels of direct oxidation solid-oxide fuel cells using dry natural gas

Sentencas: This paper, which develops a plug-flow model for fuel (natural gas surrogate) within the anode channels, considers the elementary gas-phase chemical kinetics of fuel pyrolysis and oxidation.
Titulo: Homogeneous kinetics and equilibrium predictions of coking propensity in the anode channels of direct oxidation solid-oxide fuel cells using dry natural gas

Sentencas: It also considers the limiting case of local chemical equilibrium.
Titulo: Homogeneous kinetics and equilibrium predictions of coking propensity in the anode channels of direct oxidation solid-oxide fuel cells using dry natural gas

Sentencas: Formation of cyclic hydrocarbon species is used to indicate deposit propensity.
Titulo: Homogeneous kinetics and equilibrium predictions of coking propensity in the anode channels of direct oxidation solid-oxide fuel cells using dry natural gas

Sentencas: Results show that the likelihood of deposit formation depends strongly on cell temperature, current density, and residence time.
Titulo: Homogeneous kinetics and equilibrium predictions of coking propensity in the anode channels of direct oxidation solid-oxide fuel cells using dry natural gas

Sentencas: Generally speaking, equilibrium favors deposit formation early in the channel whereas, owing to limited residence time, the homogeneous finite-rate kinetics predicts relatively low levels of deposit precursors.
Titulo: Homogeneous kinetics and equilibrium predictions of coking propensity in the anode channels of direct oxidation solid-oxide fuel cells using dry natural gas

Sentencas: In the downstream portions, because of electrochemical oxygen flux though the electrode-electrolyte membrane, chemical equilibrium shifts strongly away from deposit formation to volatile carbon-oxygen species.
Titulo: Homogeneous kinetics and equilibrium predictions of coking propensity in the anode channels of direct oxidation solid-oxide fuel cells using dry natural gas

Sentencas: However, the homogeneous finite-rate kinetics predictions show a continuing increase in coking propensity.
Titulo: Homogeneous kinetics and equilibrium predictions of coking propensity in the anode channels of direct oxidation solid-oxide fuel cells using dry natural gas
